posts.content:
Hi everyone!

A few months ago I was introduced to NWN by a friend so I'm new to this forum and new to this game. Last week I finanlized my first character build using the CBC excel tool http://nwvault.ign.com/View.php?view=ot ... ail&id=856. So I would like to share it with you (please go easy ).

In the party my role is to be the evoker and healer; so I tried to combine the Druid class with Shadowdancer class for hide in plain sight and with Champion of Torm class to reach WIS 30+ asap for dragon shape. Why the Shadowdancer class for hide in plain sight? Because we all play casters classes and we may need to make a run for it occasionally Likely we are only going to play pre-epic but I decided to finalize the build, maybe I'm gonna use it another time.

Here we go!


The Deceiving Druid (Druid 28 / Shadowdancer 2 / Champion of Torm 10)
Human, true neutral
Playable 1 - 40, PvM (not tested)

Abilities
STR: 10
DEX: 14
CON: 8
WIS: 18 (34)
INT: 12
CHA: 10

Leveling guide
Human: (Quick to Master)
01: Druid(1): Spell Focus: Evocation, Spell Focus: Conjuration
02: Druid(2)
03: Druid(3): Spell Penetration

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hey man,

Welcome to the ECB. Hope you find your stay here to be rewarding. For starters, I would like to refer you to a guide I wrote about the basics of character building.

http://nwnecbguild.44.forumer.com/a-com ... 15440.html

Secondly, about the build itself, I see some problems with it:

1- You don't have another class to do Tumble dumps in, nor any levels of CoT pre-epic, which means you don't get as many feats, but have 2 as a requirement already. If you went Monk instead of SD, and changed your spread to Druid 24 / Monk 6 / CoT 10, you'd receive free KD and IKD and could count on Monk Speed bonuses instead of HiPS to run away.

Also, you'd get Monk Attack progression and Wisdom AC bonus while in Dragon Shape, which is very handy. You could change your build a little to take 4 levels of CoT pre-epic (before 20), which would grand you +1 attack per round and use the bonus feats to get two Combat feats (Blind Fight and Expertise, for example). That way you would have +5 AC and the Breath Weapon to combo. You could throw your breath in Expertise mode gaining +5 AC at ZERO cost. Losing Dodge and Mobility, you could re-take for example Greater Spell Penetration in pre-epic (or swap these 2 feats for Extend and Empower Spell). I would go Druid 12 Monk 4 CoT 4 before 20, drop spell focus in one school for more power overall. The only problem is that this has been done to death, as my companions can probably agree. But, there's a reason for it to be done to death, and that is because it's soooooo good .

2- Presuming you don't take my advice on the previous item, you can take Druid 20 and then take SD at lvl 21, which would get you +1 AB.

3- Spell Penetration isn't that necessary, at least not unless you're facing high SR Monks, but if you are, then your 28 Caster Levels probably won't be enough, even with ESP and Nature's Balance.

4- Your AB is low, your AC isn't, I'd take Epic Prowess for Armor Skin. Actually, I'd take it in place of the Spell Focus feats in one school.

5- One of the main benefits you'd get for adding Monk for SD is that you'd get to take max Tumble at 37, but even if you don't, there's no reason to take SD before 20, and no reason not to take the second SD level at 37, you'd get 4 AC with that.

6- One common mistake you see in novice builders is that they try to accomplish too much in a build, and you're doing this here. Whenever you improve something, you have to worsen something else. This is the way things work. You're trying to be a good caster, but since you don't have Empower, Maximize or Still Spell, you have little to no spellbook management. You don't have Extend for your buffs, which is, IMO, vital for your success, because you pre-buff before shifting to Dragon or Elemental shape, and that will allow you to stay stronger for longer. and sice you're shifted, there's no re-buffing for you, so extend is very important.

Anyway, don't get discouraged by my comments. If it's any consolation, my first builds were MUCH worse than yours when I first joined the guild. Some of the elders can vouch for that. Live and learn, I guess. You'll find all the tools here to become a better builder. I suggest you read the guide I referred you to so that you can understand my feedback and any other that may come after it.

Take it EZ!

Hello Maximillian,

Thank you for your input! Based on your recommendations I made the following CB. This guy is still a good spell caster pre-epic, but way more versatile (both ranged and melee) and skills are only spend when favored by class type.

Still I've choosen to RP as a Druid caster. So this time the Monk class will give me MS and AC bonus. But still I will like to fight as a druid, so that's why I've deceided to take WF spear instead of kama (well, can still decided during the game ). As a druid caster the Evocation spells are propably most usefull, so I dropped Conjuration spell school. And SP might me not that usefull as you noticed, so yes, empower spell and extens spell are better options.

More focused on the pre-epic module we are going to play I decided to take as many Druid and Monk classes to become a simular 'deceiving druid'. The bonus feats of CoT are used in the epic part to take WIS 30. Then the CoT classes are used to take STR higher to become a versatile character. Another version of Dr 24 / M 6 / CoT 10

Thank you again for the input, I this version is much better Still room for improvement?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
There is still some room for improvement. If you move 2 of those Monk levels to epic, you gain +1 AB and you get later skill dumps in Tumble for more AC.
If you also move 2 Druid levels to epic and take 4 levels of CoT pre-epic, you gain another AB and another attack per round. Doing this would cost you two epic feats, so you would have to choose either 2 less WIS or 2 less STR, but you would gain 2 pre-epic feats, which you could use for Weapon Focus: Longbow and Point Blank Shot. If you insist on sticking to Druid weapons, take the focus in slings instead.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote:There is still some room for improvement. If you move 2 of those Monk levels to epic, you gain +1 AB and you get later skill dumps in Tumble for more AC.
If you also move 2 Druid levels to epic and take 4 levels of CoT pre-epic, you gain another AB and another attack per round. Doing this would cost you two epic feats, so you would have to choose either 2 less WIS or 2 less STR, but you would gain 2 pre-epic feats, which you could use for Weapon Focus: Longbow and Point Blank Shot. If you insist on sticking to Druid weapons, take the focus in slings instead.
Agreed on most counts, I still don't understand the STR enhancements. All Druid shapes override STR, so those feats are totally wasted. I wouldn't take WF longbow, I would prefer having Disarm / Improved Disarm or Point Blank Shot & Rapid Shot. Or you could take Weapon Finesse to improve your DEX shapes plus Blind Fight.

I would definitely move 4 of these CoT levels to pre-epic to get a full attack schedule. So, as I said, I'd start with Monk at lvl 1, then Druid,to lvl 6, Then Monk at 7, then Druid till lvl 11, then Monk at 12, then Next Monk at 17 and the 4 CoT levels at 16, 18, 19, 20. Then I would take Druid straight to 23 (23 levels of Druid, not character levels), then CoT to get more Wisdom enhancements and one Monk either at lvl 27 or 32, Dragon Shape at Druid 24 (which will come earlier if you just go for Wisdom and forget about STR enhancements). Then round up the build with CoT levels and the last Monk level at 37.

I would consider taking WF on a Kama to meet the requirements for CoT, doesn't mean you should even walk around with one, cuz you're not supposed to melee EVER in Human form.

Also, I wrote a Druid guide, so feel free to read it in the Game Guides section of this forum. It might be useful to you.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Looks pretty fine-tuned to me except for the later Animal Empathy skill dumps from lvl 38-40. It's preferable to drop Hide and Move Silently for Listen (to detect your foes) and another skill, for example, lore, which then you can dump your last points into on those last Druid levels. Other than that, looks like a pretty cool build to me. I would be cautious posting it, though, as there are MANY similar builds everywhere, so it probably doesn't have enough originality to deserve its own topic, nevertheless, it should kick ass

Take it EZ!

Hey Maximillian,

Thanks for your help! I figured since we have a small party I don't realy need Animal Empathy
We also have a Wizard (so that makes already two companions, no need for AE) with Lore so that would be fine. Listen however could be of interest indeed. I'll try to include that as well.

Thanks again. Likely we will start tonight with 'The Prophet'
